title: Fans mock Switzerland duo Granit Xhaka and Stephan Lichtsteiner over shocking free-kick routine
text:
Former Arsenal team-mates Granit Xhaka and Stephan Lichtsteiner were involved in a bizarre free-kick routine during Switzerland's defeat to Denmark.

Xhaka, who was recently named Arsenal's captain, initially ran past the ball.

Lichtsteiner, at Augsburg having endured a difficult campaign with the Gunners last season, then burst forward but instead of being found by Xhaka, the latter hesitated and just stood over the ball.

Switzerland's Granit Xhaka and Stephan Lichsteiner were involved in bizarre free-kick routine

The set-piece started with Arsenal midfielder Xhaka running past the ball

As Xhaka comes back, Lichtsteiner then darts forward, seemingly ready to be played in

It’s a real shame we didn’t get more Swiss genius like this at Arsenal with Xhaka and Lichtsteiner. pic.twitter.com/yUA6IMmuEa — Dylan Walsh (@dylanwalsh_) October 13, 2019

Denmark won 1-0 in the Euro 2020 qualifier courtesy of a goal from Yussuf Poulsen, but it was Xhaka and Lichtsteiner's exploits that attracted the majority of the attention.

One Arsenal fan wrote: 'What nonsense is this??'

With Lichtsteiner moving into position, his old Arsenal team-mate Xhaka stands over the ball

However, instead of playing in Lichtsteiner, Xhaka ends up just standing over the ball

Another wrote: 'My word....what did we do to deserve these?'

Meanwhile, another added: 'What were they doing'.

Another wrote: 'My captain everybody'.

What nonsense is this?? 🤣🤣🤣🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️ — Shaheen Ashraf (@topgooner100) October 13, 2019

My word....what did we do to deserve these? — Dikko Mustapha (@Diccoooo) October 13, 2019

What were they doing — David (@David30624700) October 14, 2019

My captain everybody — CelaBOSS (@TokNekLu) October 14, 2019

Switzerland are currently in third place in qualifying Group D and still have a chance of making it through to Euro 2020.

They will return to action on Saturday with a home game against Republic of Ireland.
description: Former Arsenal team-mates Granit Xhaka and Stephan Lichtsteiner were involved in a bizarre free-kick routine during Switzerland's defeat to Denmark.
